snippet: The economy has added more jobs and is hiring more people, but the pay is still lousy.
abstract: Editorial welcomes jobs data that shows United States economy added 288,000 jobs in June, bringing job creation in last year to 2.49 million; notes that unemployment rate fell to 6.1 percent, lowest level in nearly six years; warns that there is still enormous slack in the economy, that hours and wages are not growing for most workers and the economy still needs fiscal and monetary support.
lead_paragraph: The economy has added more jobs and is hiring more people, but the pay is still lousy.
